required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preventing Non-communicable Diseases in Guatemala Through Sugary Drink Reduction
clinical_study.official_title: Preventing Non-communicable Diseases in Guatemala Through Sugary Drink Reduction

collaborator.agency: Fogarty International Center of the National Institute of Health

brief_summary.textblock: Sugar-sweetened beverages are a significant contributor to adult and childhood obesity in Guatemala. Policies to place health warning labels on sugar-sweetened beverages are being pursued, but there is little empirical data on how such labels influence people. The primary aim of this study is to test the association between sugar-sweetened beverage (SSB) warning posters compared to control posters and change in SSBs purchased compared to baseline by adolescents shopping at school cafeterias in Guatemala City, Guatemala. The hypothesis is that posters with information warning people of the health harms associated with overconsuming SSBs and promoting low sugar beverages will be associated with greater reductions in SSB purchases compared to a control poster.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Three private schools will be enrolled in the study (two larger, one smaller) that have students between the ages of 12 and 18. There will be no posters displayed at any of the schools during the baseline period. The two larger schools will be randomized to either an SSB warning/non-SSB promoting poster or a calorie/control poster that will be implemented in the school cafeterias during a four-week intervention period. To increase the sample size for the intervention condition, the intervention will also be implemented at a smaller school. For the primary analysis, data only from schools that were randomized to condition will be used. Data was collected from both a sample of participants & from the cash registers directly.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be told the researchers are interested in cafeteria purchase preferences, but participants will not know which condition has been assigned to individual participants.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study period (either 4 weeks baseline, or 4 weeks intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Total milliliters of SSBs per transaction from sales data

primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study period (either 4 weeks baseline or 4 weeks intervention)
primary_outcome.description: Total number of calories for all beverages (SSBs and non-SSBs) per transaction from sales data

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through time frame (either 4 weeks baseline, or 4 weeks intervention)
secondary_outcome.description: Total number of calories for all food and beverages (SSBs and non-SSBs) per transaction from purchase assessments (e.g., calories from Coke + bag of chips)

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Transactions With SSBs Out of All Food and Beverage Transactions
other_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with transactions that have sugar sweetened beverages out of all participants who had food and beverage transactions

other_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Transactions With SSBs Out of All Beverage Transactions
other_outcome.description: Percentage of participants with transactions that have sugar sweetened beverages out of all participants who had beverage transactions
Average of perceptions of healthiness (measured on Likert scales) for two items (1=Extremely unhealthy; 7=Extremely healthy, lower values are more accurate)
Average of perceptions of healthiness (measured on Likert scales) for two items (1=Extremely unhealthy; 7=Extremely healthy, higher values are more accurate)

other_outcome.measure: Perceived Influence of Poster Among Those Who Saw it
other_outcome.description: "Do you think the poster influenced what you purchased?" (1=Not at all; 5=Very much, higher values in the intervention condition indicate the intervention is perceived to be effective)
"How much do you trust the information on the poster?" (1=Not at all; 5=Very much, higher values in the intervention condition indicate the intervention is perceived to be trustworthy)

arm_group.description: This poster will display images of both SSBs and low or no sugar beverages with calories listed below the beverages. It will simply state that those beverages are sold in the school store.

arm_group.arm_group_label: SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster
arm_group.description: This poster will display images of both SSBs and low or no sugar beverages with calories listed below the beverages. In addition, the message will state that SSBs are high in sugar and should be avoided, while low or no sugar beverages are healthier options and should be chosen.
We will collect baseline data from a group of students before posting the Calorie/Control Poster in the control school.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Baseline for SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster
arm_group.description: We will collect baseline data from a group of students before posting the SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster in the intervention school.

intervention.description: Red stop sign and avoidance message for sugar-sweetened beverages and green check mark and promotion message for non-sugar-sweetened beverage nutrition information
intervention.arm_group_label: SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster

intervention.description: Calories for sugar-sweetened and non-sugar-sweetened beverages
intervention.arm_group_label: SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Between 12 and 18 years old
- Made a food or beverage purchase
- Has permission from parent or caregiver to participate
- Has not yet completed the purchase assessment
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under 12 or over 18 years old
- Did not make a food or beverage purchase
- Parent or caregiver refused to give child permission to participate
- Already participated in the purchase assessment

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: We do not report data from 166 participants collected at a 3rd smaller school because that school was assigned (not randomized) to the SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster because of its smaller size.

group.title: Baseline for Calorie/Control Poster
group.description: We will collect baseline data from a group of students before posting the Calorie/Control Poster in the control school.

group.title: Baseline for SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster
group.description: We will collect baseline data from a group of students before posting the SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster in the intervention school.

group.title: Calorie/Control Poster
group.description: This poster will display images of both Sugar Sweetened Beverages (SSBs) and low or no sugar beverages with calories listed below the beverages. It will simply state that those beverages are sold in the school store. Exposure to beverage calorie information: Calories for sugar-sweetened and non-sugar-sweetened beverages

group.title: SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster
group.description: This poster will display images of both Sugar Sweetened Beverages (SSBs) and low or no sugar beverages with calories listed below the beverages. In addition, the message will state that SSBs are high in sugar and should be avoided, while low or no sugar beverages are healthier options and should be chosen. Exposure to beverage health information: Red stop sign and avoidance message for sugar-sweetened beverages and green check mark and promotion message for non-sugar-sweetened beverage nutrition information Exposure to beverage calorie information: Calories for sugar-sweetened and non-sugar-sweetened beverages

participants_list.participants: This was a cross-sectional study, so participants at baseline -- were not the same as exposure.
This was a cross-sectional study, so participants at baseline -- were not the same as exposure.

baseline.population: Baseline data on race was not collected for participants assigned to the Arms/Groups "Calorie/Control Poster" and "SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster" because these data were collected in Guatemala and race would have a different meaning than race in the United States.

group.title: Baseline for Calorie/Control Poster
group.description: We will collect baseline data from a group of students before posting the Calorie/Control Poster in the control school.

group.title: Baseline for SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster
group.description: We will collect baseline data from a group of students before posting the SSB Warning and Non-SSB Promotion Poster in the treatment school.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

measure.title: Race and Ethnicity Not Collected
measure.population: Race and Ethnicity were not collected from any participant.

outcome.title: Volume of SSBs Per Transaction
outcome.description: Total milliliters of SSBs per transaction from sales data
outcome.time_frame: Through study period (either 4 weeks baseline, or 4 weeks intervention)
outcome.population: In addition to the surveys with the participants (described in the participant flow), data on total sales were collected at the register. It is not possible to know if these sales data were associated with one or more than one participant because they are at the sales item level. For the purposes of this report, the number of participants are identical to the number of items sold.

outcome.title: Perceived Influence of Poster Among Those Who Saw it
outcome.description: "Do you think the poster influenced what you purchased?" (1=Not at all; 5=Very much, higher values in the intervention condition indicate the intervention is perceived to be effective)
outcome.population: Only asked in the treatment period of participants who reported seeing a poster.

outcome.title: Poster Message Trust
outcome.description: "How much do you trust the information on the poster?" (1=Not at all; 5=Very much, higher values in the intervention condition indicate the intervention is perceived to be trustworthy)
outcome.population: Only asked during the intervention period.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
